movies.title: Home: The House Imp
movies.plot: A middle-aged father cannot find his place at work or home. He is transferred to Iwate from Tokyo. The father takes his wife, two kids and mother with him. They settle down in a 100-year-old house. There in the countryside they meet Zasikiwarasi and begin to unite together as a family.
movies.simplePlot: A family in ruins recovers through their encounter with a "Zasikiwarashi", the japanese spirit.

biography.bio: Ai Hashimoto was born on January 12, 1996 in Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan. She is an actress, known for Confessions (2010), The Kirishima Thing (2012) and Parasyte: Part 1 (2014).
biography.name: Ai Hashimoto

biography.bio: Renji Ishibashi was born on August 9, 1941 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Audition (1999), Bird People in China (1998) and Dead or Alive (1999).
biography.name: Renji Ishibashi

biography.bio: Ken Utsui was born on October 24, 1931 in Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor, known for Wataru seken wa oni bakari (1990), Evil Brain from Outer Space (1965) and Attack from Space (1965). He was married to Fumie Kase and Yurie. He died on March 14, 2014 in Tokyo.
biography.name: Ken Utsui

biography.bio: Naoko Iijima was born on February 29, 1968 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Messengers (1999), Saigo kara nibanme no koi (2012) and Zero Woman: Final Mission (1995). She was previously married to Nobuteru Maeda.
biography.name: Naoko Iijima

biography.bio: Kazushige Nagashima was born on January 26, 1966 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor and producer, known for Ponyo (2008), Mr. Rookie (2002) and Postman (2008).
biography.name: Kazushige Nagashima

biography.bio: Yutaka Mizutani was born on July 14, 1952 in Ashibetsu, Hokkaido, Japan. He is an actor, known for Aibô (2000), The Youth Killer (1976) and A Boy Called H (2013).
biography.name: Yutaka Mizutani

biography.bio: Reiko Takashima was born on July 25, 1964 in Yokohama, Japan. She is an actress, known for La servante et le samouraï (2004), Space Battleship Yamato (2010) and Nagasaki burabura bushi (2000). She was previously married to Noboru Takachi.
biography.name: Reiko Takashima

biography.bio: Reiko Kusamura was born on July 5, 1944 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Shall We Dance? (1996), Le samouraï du crépuscule (2002) and Rentaneko (2012).
biography.name: Reiko Kusamura

biography.bio: Born in 1951, Haruo Yanagihara was born in Tokyo, Japan and has over 100 TV and cinema credits to his name including the 1999 version of Godzilla. Primarily, however, Bengaru remains a comedian. Speaking of which, Haruo Yanagihara chose this alias because he once saw a Bengal tiger and decided to copy the animal's posture resulting in a friend giving him that nickname.
biography.name: Bengaru

biography.bio: Yasunori Danta was born on January 24, 1957 in Kyoto, Japan. He is an actor, known for Sennen no koi - Hikaru Genji monogatari (2001), The Fugitive: Kijima Jouichirou (2005) and 3 oku yen jiken (2014).
biography.name: Yasunori Danta

biography.bio: Narumi Yasuda was born on November 28, 1966 in Bunkyo, Tokyo, Japan as Narumi Kinashi. She is an actress, known for Jipangu (1990), Taiga no itteki (2001) and Marilyn ni aitai (1988). She has been married to Noritake Kinashi since 1995.
biography.name: Narumi Yasuda

biography.bio: Mitsuko Kusabue was born on October 22, 1933 in Yokohama, Japan. She is an actress, known for And Then (1985), Une femme dans la tourmente (1964) and The Inugami Family (1976).
biography.name: Mitsuko Kusabue

biography.bio: Tomio Umezawa is an actor, known for Yaeko no Humming (2016), Keiji damashii (2012) and My SO Has Got Depression (2011).
biography.name: Tomio Umezawa

biography.bio: Tatsuomi Hamada is an actor, known for Ultraman Zero: The Revenge of Belial (2010), Home: The House Imp (2012) and The Copycat Criminal (2016).
biography.name: Tatsuomi Hamada

biography.bio: Daikichi Sugawara is an actor, known for Princess Mononoke (1997), Hula Girls (2006) and Tetto Musashino-sen (1997).
biography.name: Daikichi Sugawara

camera: Arri Alexa, Zeiss Master Prime and Angenieux Optimo Lenses

titlesAwards.titleAwardOutcome: Nominated Award of the Japanese Academy
